sentence.text: He discovered to his astonishment that Frank now professed atheism .
It was a measure of Arnold 's astonishment that he used the dialect expression of concern .
She realised with astonishment that he was actually pleading .
She saw his fear , his bewilderment , and above all , a kind of astonishment at the enormity of the complications that lay ahead .

My previous astonishment at the fact that people who came here like De Michelis [ the former foreign secretary ] , or like ex-Prime Minister Andreotti , never endowed us with any money is now diminished .
Martha replied , and left her twin sister blinking in astonishment at a possibility that had n't occurred to her before , but which was now enticingly attractive .
Mrs Syms 's astonishment at her appearance was almost comical .
Carolyn watched him , caught between her astonishment at his presence here , and the sudden absolutely natural way they were talking .
He stopped , becoming aware of the glare from his uncle and the frank astonishment from his agent .
The anger and astonishment in her face gave way to something very like pity .
The boy bowed again , enjoying her astonishment in the same way he had enjoyed the applause of the T'ang earlier that day when he had played Tsu Tiao .
I heard no more of the debate and to the astonishment of my fellow delegates I stormed out of the auditorium and locked myself away in the Ladies to howl out my rage , alone .
It was there , that same until-then-pleasant morning , to the astonishment of all the workers in the Library , that Stour stumbled into the Great Chamber and laid his burden down .
I chuckled at the astonishment on her face .
Suddenly , to the Collector 's astonishment , the Padre gripped him by the throat and shouted : " A matter of opinion !
As he drove out of his allotted space , to his astonishment he saw Alexandra about to get into her white saloon .
Bob sat up on the bed and gazed at her in astonishment .
The driver watched in astonishment as the car whacked into the side of his vehicle .
Miss Logan concealed her astonishment at this curious lecture , but felt bound to enquire further .
But there was some astonishment at the size and timing of the exceptional write-offs , which will result in 9,000 job losses from a worldwide total of 128,600 .
John Lahr told me of his astonishment at how unpleasant he could be to waiters at the Indian restaurant they visited together .
When the peat-brown eyes fixed on hers again , their level gaze showed he had recovered from his astonishment at seeing her .
Her eyes were wide open , and upon her face was an expression of absolute astonishment .
Sonia and Helen flung themselves into my arms , to Joe 's great astonishment .
But when I looked up , I saw , to my great astonishment , a large island in the sky , between me and the sun .
To her own mild astonishment she murmured , ` I 'll try . "
AN OXFORDSHIRE reader expresses astonishment that so many of the hotels featured in this column border on Fawlty Towers .
We write to express astonishment at the standard of writing that has featured in much of your pre-election coverage .
Lomponda wa Botende , a former Chief of Staff , expressed his astonishment at the report , and the Defence Ministry denied that any coup attempt had been made .
He felt a mixture of astonishment at himself and irritation that his rigid daily routine was going to be broken after forty undisturbed years .
Rebecque could not hide his astonishment .
As he looked around he could not hide his astonishment .
Alexei was unable to hide his astonishment at Siban 's subdued tone .
Chambers shot him a look of astonishment , then turned to include Nora
Elaine Morris stared out of the window in astonishment .
He left so quickly that she stared in astonishment at the door he had closed behind him .
